Discover Peoria Blog








 Back

Drama, Drama, Drama!

By Guest Writer:  Rachel Mangiapane on

					May. 04, 2023
				






Fun fact, the following acclaimed actors—Richard Pryor, David Ogden Stiers and Cynthia Stone—began their careers in the Greater Peoria Area! To this day, Greater Peoria has a thriving theatrical community. Here are some great places to sit back, relax, laugh, cry, or sing along. 
 
 
Artistic Community Theatre  {Pekin}  //  For an intimate experience,  head over to this 50-seat theatre for a cabaret style performance.  In true midwestern fashion, you can select a ticket that comes with a meat and cheese plate. 

 
Corn Stock Theatre  {Peoria}    //    Outdoor performing has a long history in Peoria. Be part of that history by enjoying a show under the tent in Bradley Park. This casual theatre has a “come as you are” dress code that encourages you to dress comfortably for the open air. 

 
Eastlight Theatre  {East Peoria}    //    Catch the shows you’ve always wanted to see as Eastlight performs “Broadway, Our Way.” With past performances such as Annie, Cats and Grease, you’ll want to find out what show they will tackle next.

 
Local Universities  {GPA}    //    You might catch a rising star by checking out a performance at one of these three regional universities: Bradley University, Eureka College, and Illinois Central College Performing Arts Center.

 
Peoria Civic Center  {Peoria}    //    This 2,196-seat theater hosts remarkable world-renowned performers, local artists, hysterical comedians, and treasured musicians. Check out the performance lineup, you won't be disappointed.

 
Peoria Players Theatre  {Peoria}    //    Another historic theatre, Peoria Players is the longest continuously-running community theatre in Illinois. Depending on the time of year, you might find a play, musical review or holiday performance. 

 
The Barn III Dinner Theatre  {Goodfield}    //    Enhance the show within this beautiful barn by enjoying a themed cocktail or hearty midwestern meal. Afterall, it’s not dinner theatre without dinner. You can also celebrate holidays at the barn by watching a themed light show.
 









Share:

























Categories:

Date Night,
							
								Things to Do,
							
								Things to Try,
							
								Arts & Culture

Author
Guest Writer:  Rachel Mangiapane
Rachel Mangiapane moved to Peoria to attend Bradley University and never left thanks to her Caterpillar career. Growing up in a very small town, the Peoria area feels like a metropolis to her! With a home in Mapleton, work in Peoria,  family in Washington and property in Cuba, she’s regularly exploring the region. You're most likely to find her at a local coffee shop, antique store or yoga studio.

By Guest Writer: Rachel Mangiapane on May. 04, 2023

 Share  





Discover Peoria Blog








 Back

15 Perfect Patios in Peoria County

By Guest Writer: Sam Scordo on

					Apr. 13, 2023
				






 
What better way to spend time outside than enjoying a meal al fresca? Enjoy a nice breath of fresh air at these perfect patios in Peoria! 
 
Brienzo’s Wood Fired Pizza  {Peoria Heights}   //   Bring the family (and your furry friends) to Brienzo’s Wood Fired Pizza! Brienzo’s covered patio is the perfect place to enjoy an endless array of wood fired deliciousness.
 
Castaways Bar and Grill  {Chillicothe}   //   Step into your own little slice of paradise at Castaways! This bar and grill’s outdoor patio is fenced in and dog friendly, making it a great spot to enjoy nice weather and a good burger.
 
Kouri’s Pub  {Peoria}   //   For outdoor dining all year round, stop by Kouri’s Pub. Complete with a huge covered patio and firepit, Kouri’s outdoor dining options means that you can enjoy a delicious dinner, al fresca, even in the snow.
 
Martini’s on Water Street  {Peoria}   //   Martini on Water Street’s covered outdoor patio is almost as big as their 100 martini menu. Explore your taste right along the riverfront at this local favorite!
 
Molly’s Pizzeria  {Chillicothe}   //   Pizza isn’t the only thing Molly’s Pizzeria is good at. They take patios to the next level, with an airconditioned, dog friendly covered patio for all patrons to enjoy.
 
Odie’s  {Chillicothe}   //   Grab a breakfast sandwich or sip a cocktail from the comfort of Odie’s outdoor tables.  Odie’s is the perfect place to enjoy downtown Chillicothe charm! 
 
Oliver’s in the Heights  {Peoria Heights}   //   70 years of history and an unbeatable pizza recipe is why people come to Oliver’s in the Heights, and their unbelievable patio space is why they stay! An enclosed patio, beer garden, and cabana bar makes this place a great hangout, rain or shine.
 
Pizza 150 Inc  {Edwards}   //   Pizza 150 Inc brings a pet friendly covered patio to a historic location, making for a dining experience you're sure to enjoy. Get a taste of history and great pizza at Pizza 150 Inc.
 
Schooners Peoria Heights  {Peoria Heights}   //   This Peoria Heights staple has been serving the community delicious burgers and sandwiches for over 40 years. With a covered (and heated) beer garden, Schooners is a great place to enjoy even better food, all year round.
 
The Fieldhouse Bar and Grill  {Peoria}   //   If you’re looking for a spot that will take care of the whole family, this local favorite is the place to go. Even the dogs are invited to enjoy their covered patio, so stop by The Fieldhouse for pizza and burgers you're sure to enjoy!
 
Hacienda El Mirador  {Peoria}   //   Experience the delicious taste of Mexican cuisine at Hacienda El Mirador! Sit in the warm breeze of the Peoria Area beneath the shade of their covered patio and enjoy international flavors.
 
Weaver’s Fresh Food and Drink  {Peoria}   //   Famous chicken tenders, lemon shake ups, pizza, and an outdoor patio to enjoy it all, what else could you need? Weaver’s outdoor tables are complete with umbrellas to top off a wonderful dining experience. 
 
Cyd’s in the Park  {Peoria}  //   Cyd’s in the Park takes al fresca dining to the next level. Enjoy their signature sandwiches and housemade soups on the patio or sit back under the trees in their beer garden. Be sure to bring the dogs as well! 
 
Obed and Isaac’s Microbrewery and Eatery  {Peoria}   //   Whether you want full sun or shade, everyone can enjoy Obed and Isaac’s beer garden. This pet friendly patio is partially covered and complete with a 24 tap bar, firepits, bocce ball and bags, which means there's something for everyone.
 
Industry Brewing  {Peoria }  //  Adirondack chairs, fire pits, tables with umbrellas, an outdoor bar, and dog friendly, what more could you need for a great outdoor dining experience? Stop by Industry Brewing for an evening of delicious food, local brews, and endless fun!

15 Perfect Patios in Peoria County

By Guest Writer: Sam Scordo on Apr. 13, 2023

 

What better way to spend time outside than enjoying a meal al fresca? Enjoy a nice breath of fresh air at these perfect patios in Peoria! 

 

Brienzo’s Wood Fired Pizza  {Peoria Heights}   //   Bring the family (and your furry friends) to Brienzo’s Wood Fired Pizza! Brienzo’s covered patio is the perfect place to enjoy an endless array of wood fired deliciousness.

 

Castaways Bar and Grill  {Chillicothe}   //   Step into your own little slice of paradise at Castaways! This bar and grill’s outdoor patio is fenced in and dog friendly, making it a great spot to enjoy nice weather and a good burger.

 

Kouri’s Pub  {Peoria}   //   For outdoor dining all year round, stop by Kouri’s Pub. Complete with a huge covered patio and firepit, Kouri’s outdoor dining options means that you can enjoy a delicious dinner, al fresca, even in the snow.

 

Martini’s on Water Street  {Peoria}   //   Martini on Water Street’s covered outdoor patio is almost as big as their 100 martini menu. Explore your taste right along the riverfront at this local favorite!

 

Molly’s Pizzeria  {Chillicothe}   //   Pizza isn’t the only thing Molly’s Pizzeria is good at. They take patios to the next level, with an airconditioned, dog friendly covered patio for all patrons to enjoy.

 

Odie’s  {Chillicothe}   //   Grab a breakfast sandwich or sip a cocktail from the comfort of Odie’s outdoor tables.  Odie’s is the perfect place to enjoy downtown Chillicothe charm! 

 

Oliver’s in the Heights  {Peoria Heights}   //   70 years of history and an unbeatable pizza recipe is why people come to Oliver’s in the Heights, and their unbelievable patio space is why they stay! An enclosed patio, beer garden, and cabana bar makes this place a great hangout, rain or shine.

 

Pizza 150 Inc  {Edwards}   //   Pizza 150 Inc brings a pet friendly covered patio to a historic location, making for a dining experience you're sure to enjoy. Get a taste of history and great pizza at Pizza 150 Inc.

 

Schooners Peoria Heights  {Peoria Heights}   //   This Peoria Heights staple has been serving the community delicious burgers and sandwiches for over 40 years. With a covered (and heated) beer garden, Schooners is a great place to enjoy even better food, all year round.

 

The Fieldhouse Bar and Grill  {Peoria}   //   If you’re looking for a spot that will take care of the whole family, this local favorite is the place to go. Even the dogs are invited to enjoy their covered patio, so stop by The Fieldhouse for pizza and burgers you're sure to enjoy!

 

Hacienda El Mirador  {Peoria}   //   Experience the delicious taste of Mexican cuisine at Hacienda El Mirador! Sit in the warm breeze of the Peoria Area beneath the shade of their covered patio and enjoy international flavors.

 

Weaver’s Fresh Food and Drink  {Peoria}   //   Famous chicken tenders, lemon shake ups, pizza, and an outdoor patio to enjoy it all, what else could you need? Weaver’s outdoor tables are complete with umbrellas to top off a wonderful dining experience. 

 

Cyd’s in the Park  {Peoria}  //   Cyd’s in the Park takes al fresca dining to the next level. Enjoy their signature sandwiches and housemade soups on the patio or sit back under the trees in their beer garden. Be sure to bring the dogs as well! 

 

Obed and Isaac’s Microbrewery and Eatery  {Peoria}   //   Whether you want full sun or shade, everyone can enjoy Obed and Isaac’s beer garden. This pet friendly patio is partially covered and complete with a 24 tap bar, firepits, bocce ball and bags, which means there's something for everyone.

 

Industry Brewing  {Peoria }  //  Adirondack chairs, fire pits, tables with umbrellas, an outdoor bar, and dog friendly, what more could you need for a great outdoor dining experience? Stop by Industry Brewing for an evening of delicious food, local brews, and endless fun!
